Richard Maltby: film/humanities scholars should give people tools to connect personal stories to larger public histories #HoMER2015
Maria Velez-Serna: more to be done to understand the generative mechanisms of cinema history beneath local instances #HoMER2015
Clara Pafort-Overduin: local case studies are growing together as research questions converge but process takes time #HoMER2015
Jon Burrows reflects on impact of Film History book on encouraging students to be producers, not just consumers of knowledge #HoMER2015
Jeff Klenotic on the rhetoric of 'new' in cinema history: is it too easy to dismiss 'old' methods/ideas before they're digested? #HoMER2015
Robert Allen to future researchers: dig where you stand, using local resources and connecting to local histories #HoMER2015
Robert Allen: cinema history methodologies must be 'zoomable' from individual cinema spaces to global systems #HoMER2015
Robert Allen: New Cinema History foregrounds cinema as historical experience, films are souvenirs of this #HoMER2015
Next up: The past & future of film history panel discussion #HoMER2015
@RyeComCultGPD calls for an 'almanac' of film history open to happenstance rather than totalising encyclopaedia #HoMER2015
